comment: We like to pin clarifications. We notice the convo going on regarding the number of cells in the human body. The exact number isn't known, and interestingly as Smithsonian points out, "using different metrics gets you different outcomes" (https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/there-are-372-trillion-cells-in-your-body-4941473/). The article estimates 37.2 trillion. Which is...a lot of "billions and billions!" And you also have to wonder---are you going to count all the bacterial cells in our body? Because that's also a whole lot. Cell bio is fascinating ;)  P.S. Wanting to focus on prokaryotic vs eukaryotic cell characteristics only? Just to let you know, we have a new video focusing only on that! https://youtu.be/Pxujitlv8wc  UPDATE: We have videos dubbed in Spanish and Portuguese using an artificial voice via https://aloud.area120.google.com to increase accessibility. See our Amoeba Sisters en Español channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1Njo3LBy53cOPngz6ArV8Q and Amoeba Sisters em Português https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYTQPX2X_mXe0ZMPi0fXxbg  Want to help translate our subtitles in any language?
